poem:
### In the Wake of Headlines

The markets rise, a tide  
of numbers lulling fears,  
as nations beneath  
the specter of might  
pivot on threats,  
precarious as stock tickers.  
In the rivers of fact,  
men play gods,  
orchestrating chaos  
while the earth listens,  
waiting,  
for those who rewrite  
its old, honest script.

Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
